page.title: 01Domesday 1985 (Bonby Wolds)
page.content: On the low section of the road leading from the{Bonby Wolds}to{Brigg road four different types of crops were noted.{Corn,wheat,barley,peas}and {sugar beet}were the ones I saw. There are also three barns on the North side of the road with a weighing station connected to a{beet base}and water tower.The roadside fields have {hawthorn hedges}with a few{ash trees amongst them. Travelling in a Northerly direction towards{Saxby Wolds}on the Western edge ,there is a lane leading to {Grange farm.}This consists of a series of storage barns,seven in all,but just four of them are used.The remaining three are derelict.{Fertiliser}and other farm equipment is stored here.To the East and North of the barns are fields full of{wheat.}On the South and West the fields are full of{beet}and
